intro: Psychotria insueta, commonly known as the "insensitive psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria insueta is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though its medicinal properties remain under study.
